headline.main: French Find Cigarette Maker Partly Liable in Cancer Death

docs.abstract: French court rules that Seita, maker of Gauloise and Gitane brand of cigarettes, is partly responsible for death of Richard Gourlain, three-pack-a-day smoker who died of lung cancer earlier in the year; decision is first time that a tobacco company has been held liable in health liability case in France; court, in reaching complicated formula for responsibility, also said that Gourlain was to blame for his illness; held Seita was respopnsible for years that Gourlain smoked when he was teenager and partly responsible for years he smoked as an adult before company put health warnings on cigarette packs in 1976; Seita to appeal ruling (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: In a ruling that could open a European front in the war against tobacco companies, a French court ruled today that Seita, maker of the Gauloise and Gitane brands of cigarettes, was partly responsible for the death of a three-pack-a-day smoker from lung cancer and cancer of the tongue. The court's decision is the first time that a tobacco company has been held responsible in a health liability case in France, where smoking is widely accepted. The court case is also one of the few anywhere that a tobacco company has lost.
